intro: Scandosorbus liljeforsii, commonly known as the Liljefors' rowan, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia, including parts of China, Korea, and Russia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are small, red berries that ripen in autumn and are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Scandosorbus liljeforsii is typically found in forested areas and thrives in cool, moist climates.
